arts.ttl: Alex Revell left frustrated by Stevenage's loss to Huddersfield Town
arts.sum: “We had to ride our luck a little bit, they clipped the bar in the last minute although I don’t think it looked like it was going in. “We’d scored a fantastic individual goal to equalise but then we get beat off a set-piece where you have a man to mark but you lose them.

arts.ttl: Huddersfield return to winning ways with hard-fought triumph at Stevenage
arts.sum: Callum Marshall and Nigel Lonwijk struck for the Terriers.

arts.ttl: Stevenage hosting England is another sign of us losing our little tag
arts.sum: "But also, just doing things as well as we can off the pitch will help us as a football club. "The players don't obviously have that because it's all about their own performances, but for us, that’s what we want to do because more people interested in this football club means more revenue to help us bring better players into the squad.

arts.ttl: Stevenage boss tells EFL to fix growing instances of keepers going down for treatment
arts.sum: Boro were on the receiving end of so-called tactical injuries at both Charlton Athletic and Shrewsbury Town in February and Bolton Wanderers manager Steven Schumacher spoke out about it after their League One match with Leyton Orient on Saturday. "I think the only way to stop it is potentially by booking staff, maybe the manager for calling it.

Stevenage have not given up hope of making a late dash for the playoffs, although they need a near-perfect end to the season to stand any chance. The Boro are nine points behind the lottery positions...

arts.ttl: Good and bad news on TV decisions for Stevenage kick-offs
arts.sum: The semi-final first legs will both take place on Saturday, May 10, with kick-off times at 12.30pm (sixth v third) and 7.45pm (fifth v fourth). There had been some fear that the date and time could be altered but the EFL have confirmed that all three of their divisions will kick off on the same day.

arts.ttl: Injury update from Alex Revell ahead of Stevenage v Huddersfield Town
arts.sum: He said: "It's obviously been good to have some time on the grass here at Brag and away from playing. Boro played 11 games in a little over a month with five weeks of Saturday-Tuesday fixtures and it took its toll.
